g4003.definition: [πεντεκαιδέκατος] from {{g4002}} and {{g2532}} and {{g1182}}; five and tenth

g4005.definition: [πεντηκοστή] feminine of the ordinal of {{g4004}}; fiftieth ({{g2250}} being implied) from Passover, i.e. the festival of "Pentecost"

g4006.definition: [πεποίθησις] from the perfect of the alternate of {{g3958}}; reliance

g4007.definition: [περ] from the base of {{g4008}}; an enclitic particle significant of abundance (thoroughness), i.e. emphasis; much, very or ever

g4008.definition: [πέραν] apparently accusative case of an obsolete derivative of πείρω (to "pierce"); through (as adverb or preposition), i.e. across

g4009.definition: [πέρας] from the same as {{g4008}}; an extremity

g4010.definition: [Πέργαμος] from {{g4444}}; fortified; Pergamus, a place in Asia Minor

g4011.definition: [Πέργη] probably from the same as {{g4010}}; a tower; Perga, a place in Asia Minor

g4012.definition: [περί] from the base of {{g4008}}; properly, through (all over), i.e. around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time (with the genitive case denoting the subject or occasion or superlative point; with the accusative case the locality, circuit, matter, circumstance or general period) In comparative, it retains substantially the same meaning of circuit (around), excess (beyond), or completeness (through).

g4013.definition: [περιάγω] from {{g4012}} and {{g71}}; to take around (as a companion); reflexively, to walk around

g4014.definition: [περιαιρέω] from {{g4012}} and {{g138}} (including its alternate); to remove all around, i.e. unveil, cast off (anchor); figuratively, to expiate

g4015.definition: [περιαστράπτω] from {{g4012}} and {{g797}}; to flash all around, i.e. envelop in light

g4016.definition: [περιβάλλω] from {{g4012}} and {{g906}}; to throw all around, i.e. invest (with a palisade or with clothing)

g4017.definition: [περιβλέπω] from {{g4012}} and {{g991}}; to look all around

g4018.definition: [περιβόλαιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g4016}}; something thrown around one, i.e. a mantle, veil

g4019.definition: [περιδέω] from {{g4012}} and {{g1210}}; to bind around one, i.e. enwrap

g4020.definition: [περιεργάζομαι] from {{g4012}} and {{g2038}}; to work all around, i.e. bustle about (meddle)

g4021.definition: [περίεργος] from {{g4012}} and {{g2041}}; working all around, i.e. officious (meddlesome, neuter plural magic)

g4022.definition: [περιέρχομαι] from {{g4012}} and {{g2064}} (including its alternate); to come all around, i.e. stroll, vacillate, veer

g4023.definition: [περιέχω] from {{g4012}} and {{g2192}}; to hold all around, i.e. include, clasp (figuratively)

g4024.definition: [περιζώννυμι] from {{g4012}} and {{g2224}}; to gird all around, i.e. (middle voice or passive) to fasten on one's belt (literally or figuratively)

g4025.definition: [περίθεσις] from {{g4060}}; a putting all around, i.e. decorating oneself with

g4026.definition: [περιΐστημι] from {{g4012}} and {{g2476}}; to stand all around, i.e. (near) to be a bystander, or (aloof) to keep away from

g4027.definition: [περικάθαρμα] from a compound of {{g4012}} and {{g2508}}; something cleaned off all around, i.e. refuse (figuratively)

g4028.definition: [περικαλύπτω] from {{g4012}} and {{g2572}}; to cover all around, i.e. entirely (the face, a surface)

g4029.definition: [περίκειμαι] from {{g4012}} and {{g2749}}; to lie all around, i.e. inclose, encircle, hamper (literally or figuratively)

g4030.definition: [περικεφαλαία] feminine of a compound of {{g4012}} and {{g2776}}; encirclement of the head, i.e. a helmet

g4031.definition: [περικρατής] from {{g4012}} and {{g2904}}; strong all around, i.e. a master (manager)

g4032.definition: [περικρύπτω] from {{g4012}} and {{g2928}}; to conceal all around, i.e. entirely

g4033.definition: [περικυκλόω] from {{g4012}} and {{g2944}}; to encircle all around, i.e. blockade completely

g4034.definition: [περιλάμπω] from {{g4012}} and {{g2989}}; to illuminate all around, i.e. invest with a halo

g4035.definition: [περιλείπω] from {{g4012}} and {{g3007}}; to leave all around, i.e. (passively) survive

g4036.definition: [περίλυπος] from {{g4012}} and {{g3077}}; grieved all around, i.e. intensely sad

g4037.definition: [περιμένω] from {{g4012}} and {{g3306}}; to stay around, i.e. await

g4038.definition: [πέριξ] adverb from {{g4012}}; all around, i.e. (as an adjective) circumjacent

g4039.definition: [περιοικέω] from {{g4012}} and {{g3611}}; to reside around, i.e. be a neighbor

g4040.definition: [περίοικος] from {{g4012}} and {{g3624}}; housed around, i.e. neighboring (used elliptically as a noun)

g4041.definition: [περιούσιος] from the present participle feminine of a compound of 4012 and {{g1510}}; being beyond usual, i.e. special (one's own)

g4042.definition: [περιοχή] from {{g4023}}; a being held around, i.e. (concretely) a passage (of Scripture, as circumscribed)

g4043.definition: [περιπατέω] from {{g4012}} and {{g3961}}; to tread all around, i.e. walk at large (especially as proof of ability); figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow (as a companion or votary)

g4044.definition: [περιπείρω] from {{g4012}} and the base of {{g4008}}; to penetrate entirely, i.e. transfix (figuratively)

g4045.definition: [περιπίπτω] from {{g4012}} and {{g4098}}; to fall into something that is all around, i.e. light among or upon, be surrounded with

g4046.definition: [περιποιέομαι] middle voice from {{g4012}} and {{g4160}}; to make around oneself, i.e. acquire (buy)

g4047.definition: [περιποίησις] from {{g4046}}; acquisition (the act or the thing); by extension, preservation

g4048.definition: [περιῤῥήγνυμι] from {{g4012}} and {{g4486}}; to tear all around, i.e. completely away

g4049.definition: [περισπάω] from {{g4012}} and {{g4685}}; to drag all around, i.e. (figuratively) to distract (with care)

g4052.definition: [περισσεύω] from {{g4053}}; to superabound (in quantity or quality), be in excess, be superfluous; also (transitively) to cause to superabound or excel

g4053.definition: [περισσός] from {{g4012}} (in the sense of beyond); superabundant (in quantity) or superior (in quality); by implication, excessive; adverbially (with {{g1537}}) violently; neuter (as noun) preeminence

g4054.definition: [περισσότερον] neuter of {{g4055}} (as adverb); in a more superabundant way

g4055.definition: [περισσότερος] comparative of {{g4053}}; more superabundant (in number, degree or character)

g4059.definition: [περιτέμνω] from {{g4012}} and the base of {{g5114}}; to cut around, i.e. (specially) to circumcise

g4060.definition: [περιτίθημι] from {{g4012}} and {{g5087}}; to place around; by implication, to present

g4061.definition: [περιτομή] from {{g4059}}; circumcision (the rite, the condition or the people, literally or figuratively)

g4062.definition: [περιτρέπω] from {{g4012}} and the base of {{g5157}}; to turn around, i.e. (mentally) to craze

g4063.definition: [περιτρέχω] from {{g4012}} and {{g5143}} (including its alternate); to run around, i.e. traverse

g4064.definition: [περιφέρω] from {{g4012}} and {{g5342}}; to convey around, i.e. transport hither and thither

g4065.definition: [περιφρονέω] from {{g4012}} and {{g5426}}; to think beyond, i.e. depreciate (contemn)

g4066.definition: [περίχωρος] from {{g4012}} and {{g5561}}; around the region, i.e. circumjacent (as noun, with {{g1093}} implied vicinity)

g4067.definition: [περίψωμα] from a comparative of {{g4012}} and ψάω (to rub); something brushed all around, i.e. off-scrapings (figuratively, scum)

g4068.definition: [περπερεύομαι] middle voice from πέρπερος (braggart; perhaps by reduplication of the base of {{g4008}}); to boast

g4069.definition: [Περσίς] a Persian woman; Persis, a Christian female

g4070.definition: [πέρυσι] adverb from {{g4009}}; the by-gone, i.e. (as noun) last year

g4071.definition: [πετεινόν] neuter of a derivative of {{g4072}}; a flying animal, i.e. bird

g4072.definition: [πέτομαι] ,    or prolongation      πετάομαι, or contracted      πτάομαιmiddle voice of a primary verb; to fly

g4073.definition: [πέτρα] feminine of the same as {{g4074}}; a (mass of) rock (literally or figuratively)

g4074.definition: [Πέτρος] apparently a primary word; a (piece of) rock (larger than {{g3037}}); as a name, Petrus, an apostle Compare {{g2786}}.

g4076.definition: [πήγανον] from {{g4078}}; rue (from its thick or fleshy leaves)

g4077.definition: [πηγή] probably from {{g4078}} (through the idea of gushing plumply); a fount (literally or figuratively), i.e. source or supply (of water, blood, enjoyment) (not necessarily the original spring)

g4078.definition: [πήγνυμι] a prolonged form of a primary verb (which in its simpler form occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses); to fix ("peg"), i.e. (specially) to set up (a tent)

g4079.definition: [πηδάλιον] neuter of a (presumed) derivative of πηδόν (the blade of an oar; from the same as {{g3976}}); a "pedal", i.e. helm

g4080.definition: [πηλίκος] a quantitative form (the feminine) of the base of {{g4225}}; how much (as an indefinite), i.e. in size or (figuratively) dignity

g4082.definition: [πήρα] of uncertain affinity; a wallet or leather pouch for food

g4083.definition: [πῆχυς] of uncertain affinity; the fore-arm, i.e. (as a measure) a cubit

g4084.definition: [πιάζω] probably another form of {{g971}}; to squeeze, i.e. seize (gently by the hand (press), or officially (arrest), or in hunting (capture)) Compare {{g4085}}.

g4086.definition: [πιθανολογία] from a compound of a derivative of {{g3982}} and {{g3056}}; persuasive language

g4088.definition: [πικρία] from {{g4089}}; acridity (especially poison), literally or figuratively

g4089.definition: [πικρός] perhaps from {{g4078}} (through the idea of piercing); sharp (pungent), i.e. acrid (literally or figuratively)

g4091.definition: [Πιλᾶτος] of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. firm; Pilatus, a Roman

g4092.definition: [πίμπρημι] ; a reduplicated and prolonged form of a primary πρέω; which occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses); to fire, i.e. burn (figuratively and passively, become inflamed with fever)

g4093.definition: [πινακίδιον] diminutive of {{g4094}}; a tablet (for writing on)

g4094.definition: [πίναξ] apparently a form of {{g4109}}; a plate

g4095.definition: [πίνω] ;  a prolonged form of      πίω;  which (together with another form)      πόω; occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses;  to imbibe (literally or figuratively)

g4096.definition: [πιότης] from πίων (fat; perhaps akin to the alternate of {{g4095}} through the idea of repletion); plumpness, i.e. (by implication) richness (oiliness)

g4097.definition: [πιπράσκω] , a reduplicated and prolonged form of      πράω;     (which occurs only as an alternate in                               certain tenses) contracted from περάω (to traverse; from the base of {{g4008}}); to traffic (by travelling), i.e. dispose of as merchandise or into slavery (literally or figuratively)

g4098.definition: [πίπτω] ,  a reduplicated and contracted form of      πέτω;   (which occurs only as an alternate in certain                         tenses); probably akin to {{g4072}} through the idea of alighting; to fall (literally or figuratively)

g4099.definition: [Πισιδία] probably of foreign origin; Pisidia, a region of Asia Minor

g4100.definition: [πιστεύω] from {{g4102}}; to have faith (in, upon, or with respect to, a person or thing), i.e. credit; by implication, to entrust (especially one's spiritual well-being to Christ)
